origin_of_ch_char_book: (Ë≤∑, ‰π∞, mai, buy) is a combination of a net (ÁΩë, wang, net) and a seashell . A net is a useful tool for gathering things, and seashells mean money. Therefore, this signifies a scene where a person is purchasing something sold in a net and is paying with seashells. (ÂÉπ, ‰ª∑, jia, price) On the left is a man, on the right is a lid of a bowl filled with goods, and a seashell ‚Äî which means money ‚Äî below the character. People are selling and buying, haggling over the price.,(Èõ¢, Á¶ª, li, leave) is composed of a bird (È≥•, È∏ü, niao, bird) and a snare (ÁΩë, wang, net) which can catch the bird. Birds are very perceptive so they fly away quickly even at the slightest hint of someone approaching. Therefore, this Chinese character evoloved to mean ‚Äúto depart‚Äù or ‚Äúto leave‚Äù.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions like a piece of unfolded net, the interlaced lines in the middle are like net lines. Bronze writing and Xiao Zhuan wrote a horizontal pen on the top of the net. Later, the " net " was added with the sound symbol " death " to become "ÁΩî", and the meaning symbol "Á≥∏" was added to form a " net ", which means it is woven with silk rope. Now the simplified characters use " net ", which is a retro usage.

"Said Wen": "The net (Gang), tied the rope at the sacrifice, to fish. From Zhe, go down the elephant net to communicate. All the nets belong to the net. ¶â∏ (ÁΩî), the net or die. ¶ãü (ÁΩë), net or from Á≥∏. †ïà (†ïÉ), Guwen net. ¶âØ, Yiwen net.‚Äù

Oracle is used as a verb to mean to set up a net to hunt, "Collection" 10514: "Net pheasant, only (get) eight." It means to catch a pheasant with a net and get eight. "Collection" 28329: "Net Deer".

Bronze inscriptions are used as names of people and clan.
humanum_short_description_en: A golden inscription is like an open net, and the middle is like a rope net intertwined. " Net " is the first article of " Net ". The original meaning is a net used to catch fish, shrimp or birds and animals.

Basic explanation of words
network
(network)
w«éng
A fishing and bird catching device made of ropes, threads, etc.: fishing nets. Snare. Open one side of the net (Yu treats it with a forgiving attitude). The net leaks and swallows the boat (Yu Fa decree is too wide to let the bad guys slip through the net).
Something shaped like a net: the electric grid. Hair net.
A crisscrossed organization or system like a net: dots. Communication network. All over the world.
Catch with a net: net to a big fish.
Shrouded like a net: red silk in the eyes.
